description: This switches usages of `_MPL.Pixelize` to use the Cython version, and it removes `_MPL.c` from the repository.
title: Switch to Cython version of pixelize_cartesian

pullrequest.title: Switch to Cython version of pixelize_cartesian

content.raw: The test failures are minor offsets; I am going to attempt to replicate the original behavior before convincing myself this is an acceptable change.

content.raw:
I'm unable to make my system fail these tests.  Can someone else see if they can recreate the failure?  I've run:

`nosetests-2.7 --with-answer-testing --answer-name=pixel --local --local-dir=/tmp/pixelizers --answer-store frontends/enzo/tests/test_outputs.py`

from changeset `331c7ef7049d` and then in changeset `068d09108046` I run:

`nosetests-2.7 --with-answer-testing --answer-name=pixel --local --local-dir=/tmp/pixelizers frontends/enzo/tests/test_outputs.py`

and ... everything passes.  Anyone have any idea?
content.html:
I'm unable to make my system fail these tests. Can someone else see if they can recreate the failure? I've run:

nosetests-2.7 --with-answer-testing --answer-name=pixel --local --local-dir=/tmp/pixelizers --answer-store frontends/enzo/tests/test_outputs.py

from changeset 331c7ef7049d and then in changeset 068d09108046 I run:

nosetests-2.7 --with-answer-testing --answer-name=pixel --local --local-dir=/tmp/pixelizers frontends/enzo/tests/test_outputs.py

and ... everything passes. Anyone have any idea?

pullrequest.title: Switch to Cython version of pixelize_cartesian

content.raw:
Got it!  So, I was actually testing equality, and getting everything fine -- since I was implicitly ignoring NaNs.  @ngoldbaum pointed out to me that the problem was the *number* of NaN values.

My scripts returned a difference of 59 NaNs between the two.  I was able to make this line up, *and* show a variation of 0.0, by adding this line:

`if overlap1 * overlap2 == 0.0: continue`

I'm going to push this up, check that the answers *now* work, and if they do, I will revert it and increment the answer test numbers.
content.html:
Got it! So, I was actually testing equality, and getting everything fine -- since I was implicitly ignoring NaNs. Nathan Goldbaum pointed out to me that the problem was the number of NaN values.

My scripts returned a difference of 59 NaNs between the two. I was able to make this line up, and show a variation of 0.0, by adding this line:

if overlap1 * overlap2 == 0.0: continue

I'm going to push this up, check that the answers now work, and if they do, I will revert it and increment the answer test numbers.
